College of Architecture.name: College of Architecture
College of Architecture.about: The College of Architecture is committed to shaping future architects with strong foundations in design, planning, and sustainable construction. It emphasizes creativity, innovation, and technical skills to prepare graduates for the challenges of modern architecture and urban development.

College of Asian and Islamic Studies.name: College of Asian and Islamic Studies
College of Asian and Islamic Studies.about: The College of Asian and Islamic Studies focuses on the history, culture, politics, and economies of Asian nations. It prepares students to engage in global affairs with a deeper understanding of Asiaâ€™s diverse societies, fostering expertise in regional development, diplomacy, and intercultural relations.
program: Bachelor of Arts in Asian Studies
Bachelor of Arts in International Studies

College of Computing Studies.name: College of Computing Studies
College of Computing Studies.about: The College of Computing Studies provides students with strong foundations in computer science, software engineering, and information technology. It equips learners with both theoretical knowledge and practical skills to innovate and solve problems using modern computing technologies.
program: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
Bachelor of Science in Information Systems

College of Criminal Justice Education.name: College of Criminal Justice Education
College of Criminal Justice Education.about: The College of Criminal Justice Education focuses on the study of crime, criminal behavior, and the justice system. It prepares students to work in law enforcement, corrections, forensic science, and other fields related to crime prevention and investigation.

College of Teacher Education.name: College of Teacher Education
College of Teacher Education.about: The College of Teacher Education trains future educators with the knowledge, skills, and values needed to teach effectively in basic and higher education. It emphasizes pedagogy, curriculum development, classroom management, and research in education.

College of Engineering.name: College of Engineering
College of Engineering.about: The College of Engineering develops future engineers equipped with technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and innovation to address real-world challenges. It emphasizes strong foundations in mathematics, science, and engineering applications across various fields.

College of Home Economics.name: College of Home Economics
College of Home Economics.about: The College of Home Economics focuses on improving quality of life and family well-being through applied knowledge in nutrition, hospitality, interior design, clothing, and family resource management. It equips students with practical and entrepreneurial skills for personal and community development.
program: Bachelor of Science in Home Economics
Bachelor of Science in Nutrition and Dietetics
Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management
Bachelor of Science in Interior Design
Bachelor of Science in Clothing Technology

College of Liberal Arts.name: College of Liberal Arts
College of Liberal Arts.about: The College of Liberal Arts offers a broad education in the humanities and social sciences, developing critical thinking, communication, and research skills. It prepares students for diverse fields through flexible programs that emphasize culture, society, and human behavior.
program: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science

College of Nursing.name: College of Nursing
College of Nursing.about: The College of Nursing is dedicated to training students in the science and art of nursing, equipping them with the knowledge, clinical skills, and compassion needed to provide quality healthcare. It emphasizes both theoretical learning and hands-on hospital experience.

College of Public Administration.name: College of Public Administration
College of Public Administration.about: The College of Public Administration develops leaders in governance, public policy, and community development. It provides students with knowledge of administrative systems, leadership principles, and ethical governance to prepare them for service in both government and non-government sectors.

College of Science and Mathematics.name: College of Science and Mathematics
College of Science and Mathematics.about: The College of Science and Mathematics provides strong foundations in natural sciences and mathematics. It equips students with analytical, problem-solving, and research skills to prepare them for careers in education, research, industry, and scientific innovation.

College of Social Sciences.name: College of Social Sciences
College of Social Sciences.about: The College of Social Sciences focuses on the study of human behavior, society, culture, and governance. It trains students to critically analyze social issues and contribute to community development, policy-making, and social advocacy.
program: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science

College of Sports Science and Phyiscal E.name: College of Sports Science and Phyiscal Education
College of Sports Science and Phyiscal E.about: The College of Sports Science and Phyiscal Education is dedicated to training students in physical fitness, sports science, coaching, and recreational management. It prepares graduates to promote health, wellness, and athletic excellence in schools, communities, and professional sports organizations.
program: Bachelor of Science in Exercise and Sports Science
Bachelor of Science in Recreation and Leisure Management
